<html><body><div><div class="js-taboolaReadMoreContent css-cm6ty9-StyledBlockContent eh7f8mi2" id="ArticleContent"><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Organisers of Monday’s protest against Israeli President Isaac Herzog’s Australian visit have blamed the NSW Premier and police for it descending into chaos, saying they should have been allowed to march.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">NSW Premier Chris Minns and Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon have defended their decisions and actions of police, while former prime minister Tony Abbott slammed the wild protest.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“There is no justification for last night whatsoever – Chris Minns is seemingly trying to bring a bit of Donald Trump’s America to Sydney,” Palestinian Action Group organiser Joshua Lees told reporters on Tuesday.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He has flagged another protest for Tuesday night, to be held outside a major Sydney police station.</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1ezcrvw-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage Isaac Herzog, visiting a Sydney school on Tuesday, started his four-day state visit to Australia on Monday. Picture: Rohan Kelly/ Pool/NewsWire" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">President Isaac Herzog, visiting a Sydney school on Tuesday, started his four-day state visit to Australia on Monday. Rohan Kelly/ Pool/NewsWire</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr Herzog, who started a four-day visit to Australia on Monday, was officially invited to Australia to mourn with the Jewish community in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack in which 15 innocents were killed and dozens more injured.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">However, protesters accuse the ceremonial head of state of overseeing a genocide in Gaza, an allegation Israel vehemently rejects.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">On Monday evening, an anti-Israel rally of thousands in Sydney turned into clashes with police, as sections of the crowd attempted to march on from Town Hall, despite a court ruling against that.</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-fp1qcp-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/44fdaacc5b1d17fddc490fc7f4e03ed6b822a456.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 640w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/44fdaacc5b1d17fddc490fc7f4e03ed6b822a456.jpg?imwidth=828&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/44fdaacc5b1d17fddc490fc7f4e03ed6b822a456.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/44fdaacc5b1d17fddc490fc7f4e03ed6b822a456.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/44fdaacc5b1d17fddc490fc7f4e03ed6b822a456.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="Protesters descended upon the streets of Sydney overnight. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Protesters descended upon the streets of Sydney overnight. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">The Palestinian Action Group forged ahead with a rally against Mr Herzog at Town Hall and march to state parliament despite losing a last-minute legal challenge to the Minns government’s decision to designate the president’s visit a “major event”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">That gave NSW Police extended powers, allowing them to shut down parts of the CBD and eastern suburbs, carry out searches and issue $5500 fines for anyone who did not comply with police directions.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">NSW Police had previously proposed an alternative route and pushed for Monday’s protest to begin at Hyde Park and end at Belmore Park.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Following the court’s decision just after 4pm on Monday, PAG organiser Josh Lees said the group planned to go ahead with the Town Hall rally.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“That’s all we’ll be doing now – heading to Town Hall for a massive protest that is happening all around the country in something like 30 cities,” Mr Lees said outside court.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>Wild scenes at Monday’s protest</strong></p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">So far, 27 people have been arrested, including 10 for assaulting police officers after the Town Hall rally.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Others protesters were handcuffed for failing to comply with officers’ directions.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Wild footage shared online from the rally showed violent clashes between protesters and police officers at Town Hall, with a man allegedly being punched by NSW Police officers.</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1lkxmbz-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" anti-Herzog rally descended into chaos as police tried to move on protesters. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">The anti-Herzog rally descended into chaos as police tried to move on protesters. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Other footage revealed officers allegedly moving Muslim attendees who were bent over in prayer.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Online, other videos showed hundreds of protesters being chased down the street by officers on horseback and on foot, allegedly spraying pepper spray to disperse the crowd.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">One video was shared on TikTok with the caption: “When you’re in a crowd crush and the police charge you on horseback and use pepper spray.”</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image Chris Minns defended the police actions. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">NSW Premier Chris Minns defended the police actions. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1ysvwbd-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 100w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=150&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 414w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=500&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/6141b691ab3405dcece91b1457503a418c907294.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="Videos showed officers allegedly pepper spraying protesters as they marched through the Sydney streets. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Videos showed officers allegedly pepper spraying protesters as they marched through the Sydney streets. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>Protest organisers hit back</strong>The organisers of Monday’s protest have hit back at the NSW government and police over the handling of the event, comparing them to what is happening in the US under President Donald Trump.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“There is no justification for last night whatsoever – Chris Minns is seemingly trying to bring a bit of Donald Trump’s America to Sydney,” PAG spokesman Joshua Lees told reporters on Tuesday.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“That cannot be allowed. We will not stand for it.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He said they should have been allowed to march.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“That’s what we continued to ask police for last night,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“But this is an attack not just on people who were trying to march, this is an attack on everyone who was just trying to have a static rally, which was completely lawful and allowed even under all these current protest restrictions at Town Hall.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He said “instead, we were bashed and pepper sprayed and brutalised”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“That was outrageous, never should have happened and there is no justification for it.”</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1lkxmbz-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 100w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=150&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 150w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=250&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 250w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=320&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 320w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=414&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 414w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=500&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 640w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=828&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/9fb1d69a2ad04bcbbcb331c0d8249916c07dc9fd.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="Josh Lees, from the Palestine Action Group, says there will be another protest on Tuesday. Picture: NewsWire / Max Mason-Hubers" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Josh Lees, from the Palestine Action Group, says there will be another protest on Tuesday. NewsWire / Max Mason-Hubers</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr Lees said there had been no threat to the 7000 Jewish mourners at an event with Mr Herzog at the ICC, a kilometre from Town Hall.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">PAG is organising another rally at Surry Hills Police Station on Tuesday night.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">NSW Greens MP Jenny Leong said protesters tried to disperse peacefully but were met by lines of “riot police”, while another Greens MP Abigail Boyd said she was punched by police.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“The next thing we knew, we started coughing and spluttering,” she said, claiming police started spraying pepper spray at them.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“We saw two or three lines of police running, chasing terrified community members as they bolted down Bathurst Street, coughing and spluttering, being sprayed by police.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>‘Riot’: Minns praises police actions</strong></p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Chris Minns told reporters there was no suggestion that police officers were trying to “cause offence” by moving the Muslim worshippers, but said “context (was) important”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“The truth of the matter is NSW Police have had a strong and co-operative relationship with Sydney’s Islamic, Arabic community, going back decades,” he said.</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1lkxmbz-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 100w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=150&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 150w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=250&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 250w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=320&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 320w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=414&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 414w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=500&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 640w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=828&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/f753f4892e40afd3f37271e28cfc238661e8a18f.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon said the protester’s actions were ‘unacceptable’. Picture: NewsWire / Nikki Short," class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon said the protester’s actions were ‘unacceptable’. NewsWire / Nikki Short,</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon backed up the Premier’s comments, saying police had “no intent to cause offence” and were “coming from a different angle” to the video, blaming the protesters for the reaction.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“I have spoken to senior community leaders from the Muslim community and I will continue to do so,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“We (want a) respectful relationship, but what you saw last night was chaos in part.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“The police were restoring order – it was the actions of the protesters that led police to go forward and disperse the crowd.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr Lanyon agreed “every officer was accountable for their actions”, but argued the officers acted accordingly.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“I’m proud of what they did last night in holding the line, as the Premier (and) as I have said, we are there to balance the right to community safety against free speech,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“While the protest was peaceful at Town Hall, police stood back, and enabled that to take place. It was not until the protesters chose to march on police, that police had to take any action.”</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1y5ylds-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 100w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=150&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 150w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=250&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 250w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=320&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 320w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=414&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 414w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=500&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 640w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=828&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/3b999046814b322199a1cdf30da8cc0eba2b3585.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="Officers were seen trying to control the crowds. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Officers were seen trying to control the crowds. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>‘Forced’: NSW Police Commissioner defends police actions</strong></p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr Lanyon said the scenes across the Sydney streets was “unacceptable”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“During the first part of the speeches, it was peaceful,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“We were working continuously with the organiser. However, speakers were inciting the crowd to march. We had made it clear throughout the week march through the CBD was not acceptable.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He told reporters NSW Police would “review the actions” taken during the protest, but argued officers had no choice but to intervene.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“The police we were forced to take action because of the action of the protesters,” he told reporters.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“The police’s responsibility is to keep community safe and prevent crime. That’s what they did last night, professionally.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“It was a significant aggressive and volatile crowd. They did a fantastic job to hold that line.”</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1y5ylds-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 100w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=150&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 150w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=250&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 250w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=320&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 320w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=414&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 414w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=500&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 640w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=828&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/de878a9deaa17aa75324043064dd6a72e5949857.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="Police have defended their actions on Monday evening. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Police have defended their actions on Monday evening. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>Police Commissioner slams ‘disgusting’ protests</strong></p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">NSW Police Assistant Commissioner Peter McKenna told 2GB some police officers were injured during violent clashes.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">One officer suffered an injury to his leg, while another left the scenes with an injured hand.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“I saw officers get punched in the face and all types of assaults upon them,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“ … it was really quite disgusting to be honest with you.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He said a few of the videos of the violent clashes had been “taken out of context”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“What I’ll say is we went out of our way to show restraint,” he told 2GB’s Ben Fordham.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“There was restraint shown for not seconds or minutes, but well over an hour, to say ‘you can’t do that’.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“When they decided to chant that they were going to march on police and they tried to march on the police and started assaulting police officers, well that’s when it turned bad then.”</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1lkxmbz-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/cb71ca6c2b44cafd842d657487c311d20feda343.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/cb71ca6c2b44cafd842d657487c311d20feda343.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/cb71ca6c2b44cafd842d657487c311d20feda343.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and Assistant Police Commissioner Peter McKenna said officers showed ‘restraint’ in the protest. Picture: Christian Gilles / NewsWire" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">NSW Assistant Police Commissioner Peter McKenna said officers showed ‘restraint’ in the protest. Christian Gilles / NewsWire</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He described the scenes as “dynamic”, “volatile” and an “outrageous situation”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">When asked about the officers charging towards the crowd on horseback, Mr McKenna said the “protesters caused this”.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“We really tried hard to make this peaceful. We didn’t want clashes,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“We gave them every opportunity to go to Hyde Park.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“Once they decided they’re at Town Hall – it still didn’t mean it had to turn out like this – but when they were hellbent on getting the crowd whipped up saying they were going to march, they were gonna take on the police, well, they left us with no choice but to try and disperse the crowd, use our powers.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr McKenna said: “It really turned into a rolling fight and a melee across the streets of Sydney which was, you know, something we didn’t want to see happen”.</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1ysvwbd-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" were seen allegedly punching protesters. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Officers were seen allegedly punching protesters. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Several protesters clashed with officers. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>‘Dagger aimed at the heart of our country’: Abbott</strong>Former prime minister Tony Abbott praised officers at the protest, saying they should receive “quiet commendation” and not face disciplinary action.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“I think it’s about time the fight back began,” he told Mr Fordham.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr Abbott said more police action was needed to control the protests.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“I think we need to see more police forces,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“We need to see tear gas and rubber bullets. It needs to be these people who are trying to intimidate the Australian community need to know that it is the forces of law and order who are in charge.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Protesters’ chants were also slammed by the former prime minister.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“This is a dagger aimed at the heart of our country, and we have got to see it for what it is,” he said.</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-1lkxmbz-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" srcset="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=100&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 100w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=150&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 250w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=320&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 320w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=414&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 414w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=500&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 500w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=640&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 640w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=828&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 828w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=1024&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 1024w,https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=2048&amp;impolicy=pn_v3 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 767px) 100vw, (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 668px"></source><img src="https://images.perthnow.com.au/publication/C-21585521/c726d97a1abb046128fa4f4ac6163c8f888bdd11.jpg?imwidth=668&amp;impolicy=pn_v3" alt="Tony Abbott said police need to do more. Picture: NewsWire / Nadir Kinani" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">The former PM said the protests were a ‘dagger aimed at the heart of the country’. NewsWire / Nadir Kinani</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>‘Don’t think that’s fair’: Minns</strong></p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Speaking to 2GB, Chris Minns rejected the notion he failed to contain the protesters and “lost control” of the city.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“I don’t think that’s fair,” the Premier said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“If you look at NSW Police and the government actions last night, they held the line, they kept the people of NSW safe from a conflict in Sydney streets.”</p><figure class="css-kn3rvr-StyledPNFigure eq8qgnw2"><picture class="eq8qgnw1 image css-8flury-PictureWithIntrinsicRatio-StyledPNArticleImage eosncpx0"><source data-ratio="4:3" media="(min-width: 0px)" said there were 7000 mourners at the ICC near the protesters. Picture: NewsWire / Gaye Gerard" class="css-16r7l45-StyledImage en5ut4d0"></picture><figcaption class="eixham80 figcaption css-mcrbmm-StyledPNCaption-StyledPNFigcaption eixham85"><svg class="eixham82 css-1fi3k2d-StyledPNCameraIcon-StyledIconPNImage e1oq86r40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" fill="none"><title>Camera Icon</title><path d="M23 19C23 19.5304 22.7893 20.0391 22.4142 20.4142C22.0391 20.7893 21.5304 21 21 21H3C2.46957 21 1.96086 20.7893 1.58579 20.4142C1.21071 20.0391 1 19.5304 1 19V8C1 7.46957 1.21071 6.96086 1.58579 6.58579C1.96086 6.21071 2.46957 6 3 6H7L9 3H15L17 6H21C21.5304 6 22.0391 6.21071 22.4142 6.58579C22.7893 6.96086 23 7.46957 23 8V19Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path><path d="M12 17C14.2091 17 16 15.2091 16 13C16 10.7909 14.2091 9 12 9C9.79086 9 8 10.7909 8 13C8 15.2091 9.79086 17 12 17Z" stroke="#666869" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg><span class="css-15pqx16-StyledPNFigCaptionText eixham84"><span class="css-1drr6t0-PNCaption eixham83">Chris Minns said there were 7000 mourners at the ICC near the protesters. NewsWire / Gaye Gerard</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">He said rally-goers ignored advice of sticking to Hyde Park for the protest.“We would have preferred it took place in Hyde Park,” he said.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">“What we can say today that we couldn’t reveal yesterday is that we had 7000 mourners down in the ICC on at the same time, in almost the same place as the protests were taking place.”</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">The ICC is about 1km from Town Hall.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><strong>Herzog visits Jewish school</strong></p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Meanwhile, Mr Herzog on Tuesday morning visited a Jewish school in eastern Sydney under tight security.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Mr Herzog visited the Moriah War Memorial College in Sydney’s east as part of pre-planned community engagement event.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Arriving at the school just after 10am, Mr Herzog’s motorcade comprised at least seven police officers on motorbikes and 12 cars.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">The Israeli president has visited a Jewish school in Sydney’s eastern suburbs on day two of his state visit.</p><figure Rohan Kelly/ Pool/NewsWire</span><span> Credit: News Corp Australia</span></span></figcaption></figure><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Earlier, groups of police officers armed with long arm rifles patrolled the streets surrounding the school, which had been locked down hours before the Israeli president’s visit.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0">Ahead of his arrival, children were heard singing and laughing at the K-12 school, which was founded in the 1940s and promotes an “understanding of and a “positive commitment to Orthodox Judaism and identification with and love for Israel”, according to the institution’s website.</p><p class="css-9cqv6l-StyledPNParagraph e8utp6u0"><em>More to come</em></p></div></div></body></html>
